DENY action requires at least one Rule: La acción DENEGAR requiere al menos una regla
A Request Routing scenario needs at leas: Un escenario de enrutamiento de solicitudes necesita al menos una regla de enrutamiento
A Rule needs at least an item in \"From\: Una regla necesita al menos un elemento en las secciones "De", "A" o "Cuando"
A valid {{kind}} name is required: Es necesario un nombre válido para {{kind}}
Add a fixed delay before forwarding the: Agrega una demora fija antes de reenviar la solicitud. Formato: 1h/1m/1s/1ms. DEBE ser mayor o igual a 1 ms.
Add Condition to When List: Agregar una condición a la sección Cuando
Allows all requests to workloads in give: Allows all requests to workloads in given namespace(s)
An Istio Config resource needs at least: An Istio Config resource needs at least one cluster selected
An Istio Config resource needs at least one namespace selected
Are you sure you want to delete ?: Are you sure you want to delete ?
Builds an Authorization Policy based on: Builds an Authorization Policy based on Rules
Check for possible configuration(s) of e: Check for possible configuration(s) of external_services.tracing
Check the usual ports for the tracing se: Check the usual ports for the tracing service and provide a subset of the tracing configuration based on the tracing services found for external_services.tracing.
Choose the traffic rates used to generat: Choose the traffic rates used to generate the graph. Each supported protocol offers one or more options. Unused protocols can be omitted.
Click kebab menu on a node label to see: Click kebab menu on a node label to see the contextual menu options for the node.
Click on a node or edge to see its summa: Click on a node or edge to see its summary and emphasize its end-to-end paths.
Client Certificate must be non empty: Client Certificate must be non empty
Debug information has been copied to you: Debug information has been copied to your clipboard.
Debug information was copied to your cli: Debug information was copied to your clipboard, but is outdated now. It could be caused by new data received by auto refresh timers.
Denies all requests to workloads in give: Denies all requests to workloads in given namespace(s)
Details in side panel on nodes: Details in side panel on nodes
Display envoy config for the selected po: Display envoy config for the selected pod
Display the legend to learn about what t: Display the legend to learn about what the different shapes, colors and backgrounds mean.
Display ztunnel config for the selected: Display ztunnel config for the selected pod
Download all resources in a file: Download all resources in a file
Either all namespaces are being filtered: Either all namespaces are being filtered or the user has no permission to access namespaces.
Enter a label in the format <label>=<val: Enter a label in the format <label>=<value>. Enter one or multiple labels separated by comma.
Filter by Application Health: Filtrar por la salud de la aplicación
Filter by Namespace: Filtrar por el espacio de nombres
Filter by Namespace Label: Filtrar por la etiqueta del espacio de nombres
Gateway hosts should be specified using: Gateway hosts should be specified using FQDN format or '*' wildcard.
Highlight or Hide graph elements via typ: Highlight or Hide graph elements via typed expressions. Click the dropdown for preset Find or Hide expressions. Click the Find/Hide help icon for details on the expression language.
Highlight or Hide mesh elements via type: Highlight or Hide mesh elements via typed expressions. Click the dropdown for preset Find or Hide expressions. Click the Find/Hide help icon for details on the expression language.
HTTP Cookie Name must be non empty and T: HTTP Cookie Name must be non empty and TTL must be expressed in in nanoseconds (i.e. 1000, 2000, etc) or seconds (i.e. 10s, 1.5s, etc).
HTTP status code to use to abort the Htt: HTTP status code to use to abort the Http request.
Istio Ambient ztunnel detected in the Co: Istio Ambient ztunnel detected in the Control plane
K8s Gateway API is not enabled: K8s Gateway API is not enabled
Match 'Any request' is defined in a prev: Match 'Any request' is defined in a previous rule.
Maximum number of HTTP1 /TCP connections: Maximum number of HTTP1 /TCP connections to a destination host.
Maximum number of pending HTTP requests: Maximum number of pending HTTP requests to a destination.
name: name
Name: Nombre
Namespace: {{namespace}} is not found in: Namespace: {{namespace}} is not found in cluster {{clusterName}}
No graph traffic for the time period.
Number of errors before a host is ejecte: Number of errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool.
Number of retries for a given request.
One or more hosts exposed by this gatewa: One or more hosts exposed by this gateway. Enter one or multiple hosts separated by comma.
One or more labels to select a workload: One or more labels to select a workload where the AuthorizationPolicy is applied.
Percentage of requests on which the dela: Percentage of requests on which the delay will be injected.
Percentage of requests to be aborted wit: Percentage of requests to be aborted with the error code provided.
Please include this information when ope: Please include this information when opening a bug:
Private Key must be non empty: Private Key must be non empty
Refresh interval. \"Pause\" refreshes on: Refresh interval. "Pause" refreshes on page change or Refresh button click. "Manual" refreshes only on Refresh button click.
Right-click or click kebab menu on a nod: Right-click or click kebab menu on a node label for links to details, traffic, inbound/outbound metrics and node graph.
Select a workload, service or applicatio: Select a workload, service or application graph view. An application view can optionally be versioned and relies on app and version labeling. Workload and service graphs provide physical and logical views, respectively.
Select how often to refresh the graph an: Select how often to refresh the graph and how much historical metric data is used to build the graph, per refresh. For example "Last 5m" means use the most recent 5 minutes of request metric data.  To replay a historical time window click the replay icon.  This replaces the current time range controls with the replay toolbar.
Select how often to refresh the mesh and: Select how often to refresh the mesh and how much historical metric data is used for metric charts. For example "Last 5m" means use the most recent 5 minutes of request metric data.
Select the graph layout for the mesh. Di: Select the graph layout for the mesh. Different layouts work best with different meshes. Find the layout that works best. Other buttons here provide zoom and fit-to-screen options.
Select the layout for the mesh. Differen: Select the layout for the mesh. Different layouts work best with different meshes. Find the layout that works best. Other buttons here provide zoom and fit-to-screen options.
Select the namespaces you want to see in: Select the namespaces you want to see in the graph.
Select the time range of shown data, and: Select the time range of shown data, and the refresh interval.
Set display options for the mesh.
Set edge labeling, node badging, and var: Set edge labeling, node badging, and various display options. Response-time edge labeling, security badging, and traffic animation may affect performance. Response-times reflect the 95th percentile.
Sorry, there was a problem. Try a refres: Sorry, there was a problem. Try a refresh or navigate to a different page.
The control plane must sync each proxy w: The control plane must sync each proxy when there is a configuration change. This is the average time spent, per proxy,                  to perform the update. N/A means there was no syncing performed for the configured time period.
The destination hosts to which traffic i: The destination hosts to which traffic is being sent. Enter one or multiple hosts separated by comma.
The minimum TLS version for connections: The minimum TLS version for connections among Istio workloads. Defaults to TLSV1_2 if not set. Set by the 'meshConfig.meshMTLS.minProtocolVersion' field.
The refresh interval is set to \"Manual\: The refresh interval is set to "Manual". To render the graph, select your desired filters and options and then click the Refresh button. Or, if preferred, change the setting to the desired interval.
The refresh interval is set to "Manual". To render the list, select your desired filters and options and then click the Refresh button. Or, if preferred, change the setting to the desired interval.
The refresh interval is set to "Manual". To render the mesh, select your desired filters and options and then click the Refresh button. Or, if preferred, change the setting to the desired interval.

The refresh interval is set to "Manual". To render the overview, select your desired filters and options and then click the Refresh button. Or, if preferred, change the setting to the desired interval.
The Side Panel shows details about the c: The Side Panel shows details about the currently selected node or edge, otherwise the whole graph.
The Side Panel shows details about the currently selected node or edge, otherwise the whole mesh.
There are no Workloads with sidecar for: There are no Workloads with sidecar for this service
There is currently no graph available fo: There is currently no graph available for the selected namespaces. This usually means the namespaces do not have measurable traffic for the selected time period:
There is currently no mesh information a: There is currently no mesh information available. This may mean you do not have permission to see any mesh information or have no access to any of the mesh namespaces.
There is currently no namespace selected: There is currently no namespace selected, please select one using the Namespace selector.
This chart shows cpu consumption for the: This chart shows cpu consumption for the {{component}} {{cpuMetricSource}}
This chart shows memory consumption for: This chart shows memory consumption for the {{component}} {{memoryMetricSource}}
This shows the meshConfig.outboundTraffi: This shows the meshConfig.outboundTrafficPolicy.mode setting. It controls the sidecar handling of                 requests to external services (services not defined in Istio’s internal service registry). When                 set to ALLOW_ANY the Istio proxy performs a passthrough to the unknown services. When set to REGISTRY_ONLY                 the Istio proxy blocks requets to hosts without a defined HTTP service or service entry.
This type of workload is read-only: This type of workload is read-only
This workload is an Istio Ambient waypoi: This workload is an Istio Ambient waypoint proxy
Timeout for HTTP requests. Format: 1h/1m: Timeout for HTTP requests. Format: 1h/1m/1s/1ms. MUST be >=1ms.
Timeout per retry attempt for a given re: Timeout per retry attempt for a given request. Format: 1h/1m/1s/1ms. MUST be >=1ms.
TLS related settings for connections to: TLS related settings for connections to the upstream service.
To read the FAQ entry about why your gra: To read the FAQ entry about why your graph may be empty,
Traffic routing already exists for this: Traffic routing already exists for this service
Traffic routing doesn't exists for this: Traffic routing doesn't exists for this service
TTL is expressed in nanoseconds (i.e. 10: TTL is expressed in nanoseconds (i.e. 1000, 2000, etc) or seconds (i.e. 10s, 1.5s, etc).
User does not have enough permission for: User does not have enough permission for this action.
User does not have permission on this Wo: User does not have permission on this Workload
User does not have permission to create: User does not have permission to create Istio Config on namespace: {{namespace}}
Values and NotValues cannot be empty: Values and NotValues cannot be empty
VirtualService Host '*' wildcard not all: VirtualService Host '*' wildcard not allowed on mesh gateway.
When enabled in an Ambient environment,: When enabled in an Ambient environment, include waypoints in the mesh topology.
When enabled, include gateways in the me: When enabled, include gateways in the mesh topology.
While the health check is based on wheth: While the health check is based on whether the URL response returns an HTTP 200, the services check performs a more exhaustive verification by attempting to analyze if the traces response is correct. It is important that internal_url is defined, as it relies on this host to perform the checks. When in_cluster config is false, it will use the external_url
You are currently displaying \"Idle node: You are currently displaying "Idle nodes". Send requests to the service mesh and click the Refresh button.
You can enable \"Idle Nodes\" to display: You can enable "Idle Nodes" to display nodes that have yet to see any request traffic.
